reviews.text:
The men’s toilet is currently out of order. Two men in my party were desperate to use the toilet facilities so I asked the c2c cleaner if they could open the disabled toilet. The cleaner was rude and dismissive and told me to go to customer services. I went to customer service and explained that there were two men that needed the toilet and one was elderly. The member of staff discussed it  with his colleague and it was a very awkward experience as they clearly didn’t want to open the toilet.  (the staff should be trained to understand that some people aren’t visibly disabled but may need to use the toilet more frequently due to ill health).
I am sorry to say the customer service I received was very poor.

How the hell they could close the station at 20:30 and show the GOOD SERVICE at the website??. After all day on your feet has to go to Liverpool Street. 
Cannot be more disappointed! 
Someone clearly does NOT do the job!

Needs more seating especially on platforms. Off peak times trains can be over 30mins apart to many destinations. Needs a lift at side entrance. People with walking problems have to walk a very awkward and long route to avoid stairs. Also more facilities at side entrance eg. Coffee shop that is open and toilets. Side entrance used just as much as main entrance. Needs modernising.
Running a good service at times
Gents toilets are appalling.  It's a veritable Piss Rink
